rules.description: Reporting Criteria for BHCs and IHCs
rules.condition: BHCs or IHCs with total consolidated assets of $100 billion or more (average of the previous four calendar quarters)
Covered SLHCs with total consolidated assets of $100 billion or more (average of the previous four calendar quarters)

rules.description: Submission of Trading and Counterparty Schedules
rules.condition: BHCs, IHCs, or SLHCs with average trading assets and liabilities of $50 billion or more, or 10% or more of total consolidated assets (two quarters preceding the reporting quarter)

rules.description: Materiality Thresholds for Category IV Firms
rules.condition: Firms subject to Category IV standards; asset balances greater than $5 billion or 10% of Tier 1 capital (average of the four quarters preceding the reporting period)

rules.description: Materiality Thresholds for Category I, II, or III Firms
rules.condition: Firms subject to Category I, II, or III standards; asset balances greater than $5 billion or 5% of Tier 1 capital (average of the four quarters preceding the reporting period)
Materiality thresholds apply; specific criteria defined in individual schedule instructions

rules.description: Submission of PPNR, Operational Risk, Regulatory Capital, Regulatory Capital Instruments, and Balances Schedules
rules.condition: All firms must submit these schedules.
All reports must be prepared in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).
Firms must apply ASU 2016-13 for FR Y-14 reporting purposes in accordance with the effective dates set forth in the ASU.
Refer to FR Y-9C General Instructions for consolidation rules.
All reports must be submitted electronically via the Reporting Central submission application.
Specific deadlines outlined in the document; extensions for new reporters.

For BHCs, IHCs, and SLHCs subject to supervision by the Federal Reserve's Large Institution Supervision Committee, the Capital Assessments and Stress Testing report must be accompanied by an attestation signed by the chief financial officer or an equivalent senior officer.

rules.description: Commercially Available Credit Bureau Score Definition
rules.condition: A credit score is a numerical value or a categorization derived from a statistical tool or modeling system that characterizes the credit risk of a borrower.
For regulatory capital items, refer to 12 CFR parts 208, 217, and 225.
